Steps to reproduce
------------------

Starting with WMF 5.1 the -NoNewLine option for Write-Host is essentially ignored.

Simple example: 
PS C:\> Write-Host "no newline test " -NoNewline

Expected behavior
-----------------
no newline test PS C:\>

Actual behavior
---------------
no newline test 
PS C:\>

Environment data
----------------

PS version Table is as follows.

PSVersion   5.1.14409.1012

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
Right test is
```powershell
Write-Host "no newline test " -NoNewline ; write-host "qqqqq"
Write-Host "no newline test " ; write-host "qqqqq"
```

comments.author: sashah363
BrucePay
comments.body: Hi @sashah363 It's actually the examples in the documentation that are problematic. `Write-Host -NoNewLine` works properly as @iSazonov  demonstrates with his examples. What you are seeing is that, after a command is run, the console host fixes the cursor position before emitting the prompt (which is exactly what it should do.)  You can see the code at [ConsoleHost.cs:2417](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/src/Microsoft.PowerShell.ConsoleHost/host/msh/ConsoleHost.cs#L2417). I suspect the doc examples date back quite a ways when we were less sophisticated in our handling of prompts.

@BrucePay @iSazonov 
Maybe this example is a little bit more obvious:
```
PS C:\> 1,2,3,4 | Write-Host
1
2
3
4
PS C:\> 1,2,3,4 | Write-Host -NoNewline
1234
PS C:\>
```

title: write-host -NoNewline parameter is ignored with powershell 5.1
